intro: Phyllanthus compressicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
